content:
Absolutely! East Austin is a vibrant community full of innovative small businesses. Here are a few up-and-coming small businesses in the area that you may want to check out:

1. Micklethwait Craft Meats: Micklethwait Craft Meats is a BBQ pit master in East Austin that has been growing rapidly over the past few years. They offer unique BBQ options and side dishes that have become a favorite of locals and tourists alike.

2. Killa Wasi: Killa Wasi is a Peruvian restaurant that started as a food truck and has since expanded to a brick-and-mortar location in East Austin. They serve traditional Peruvian cuisine with a modern twist, blending classic recipes with innovative techniques.

3. Public Sourdough: Public Sourdough is a bakery that specializes in sourdough bread and pastries. They use organic ingredients and offer a rotating selection of delicious baked goods baked fresh every day.

These businesses, along with many others, are continuously contributing to the unique cultural and culinary identity of East Austin. There are many exciting new small businesses popping up in the area, and supporting them is a great way to help maintain the area's vibrant local economy.
